title: 108_s1916
content: The Act titled "Military Survivor Benefits Improvement Act of 2003" provides full SBP survivor benefits for surviving spouses over the age of 62. The Act "Military Survivor Benefits Improvement Act of 2003" increases the basic annuity to 55 percent for months beginning after September 2014. Reserve-component and special-eligibility annuities are also adjusted accordingly. The Act "Military Survivor Benefits Improvement Act of 2003" increases the basic annuity to 55 percent for months beginning after September 2014. Reserve-component and special-eligibility annuities are also adjusted accordingly. Amendments are made to percentages and computation of annuities under title 10, United States Code. The Act "Military Survivor Benefits Improvement Act of 2003" increases annuity percentages to 20% before October 2005, 15% after September 2005 and before October 2008, and 10% after September 2008. Chapter 73 is repealed in 2014, and annuities under section 1450 of title 10 are recomputed monthly. The annuity percentages under the Military Survivor Benefits Improvement Act of 2003 are recomputed monthly for specific months, including October 2005, October 2008, and October 2014. The annuity percentages under the Military Survivor Benefits Improvement Act of 2003 are recomputed monthly for specific months, including October 2005, October 2008, and October 2014. The Secretary of Defense will adjust retired pay reductions to achieve the objectives set forth in the Act. The open enrollment period for Survivor Benefit Plan starts on October 1, 2005, as per the Military Survivor Benefits Improvement Act of 2003. The annuity percentages are recalculated monthly for specific months, including October 2008 and October 2014, with adjustments made by the Secretary of Defense to meet the Act's objectives. During the open enrollment period, eligible retired or former members can elect to participate in the Survivor Benefit Plan and the Supplemental Survivor Benefit Plan if not currently enrolled. Eligibility criteria include being entitled to retired pay. During the open enrollment period, eligible retired or former members can elect to participate in the Survivor Benefit Plan. Those entitled to retired pay or would be entitled under specific conditions can make elections for standard or reserve-component annuities under the plan. During the open enrollment period, eligible participants in the Survivor Benefit Plan can elect to increase coverage or participate in the Supplemental Survivor Benefit Plan for their spouse or former spouse. During the open enrollment period, eligible participants in the Survivor Benefit Plan can elect to participate in the Supplemental Survivor Benefit Plan if they are providing annuity coverage for their spouse or former spouse. Eligibility is based on current participation levels and annuity computations. During the open enrollment period, eligible participants in the Survivor Benefit Plan can elect to have their annuity computed under a specific section of the United States Code. This election must be made in writing, signed, and received by the Secretary concerned before the enrollment period ends. The election allows for the same conditions, opportunities for beneficiary designation, and base amount specification as the Survivor Benefit Plan or Supplemental Survivor Benefit Plan. Additionally, a person electing to provide a reserve-component annuity must make a designated described in the United States Code. During the open enrollment period, eligible participants in the Survivor Benefit Plan can elect to have their annuity computed under a specific section of the United States Code. The election must be made in writing and received by the Secretary concerned before the enrollment period ends. If a person making an election dies within two years, the election is void, and any reduction in retired pay attributable to the election will be paid in a lump sum to the designated beneficiary. Certain provisions of the United States Code apply to these elections. The provisions of sections 1449, 1453, and 1454 of title 10, United States Code, apply to elections made under this section. The Secretary of Defense may require an additional premium for these elections, not exceeding 4.5 percent of the base amount. A report on the open season must be submitted to the Committees on Armed Services by July 1, 2005. The Secretary of Defense will submit a report to the Committees on Armed Services regarding the open season for the Survivor Benefit Plan. The report will detail the implementation plans, cost estimates, and any recommendations for further legislative action.
